title: 108_s348
content: The "Make College Affordable Act of 2003" is introduced, which includes an expansion of the deduction for higher education expenses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment sets limitations on the amount allowed as a deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses for taxpayers in any taxable year. The deduction for higher education expenses is limited based on modified adjusted gross income. For the taxable year 2003, the limit is $8,000, and for 2004 and beyond, it is $12,000. The reduction in the deduction amount is based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeding $65,000 ($130,000 for joint returns). The modified adjusted gross income limit for the deduction of higher education expenses is based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income for the taxable year, excluding certain sections and after applying specific adjustments. Adjusted gross income for the deduction of higher education expenses is determined without considering the deduction allowed under this section. Dollar amounts are increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $50, it is rounded accordingly. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow a deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses of eligible students. The definition of an eligible student is clarified, and the deduction is made permanent under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001. The term 'eligible student' is defined in section 25A(b)(3). The deduction for qualified tuition expenses is made permanent under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001. The amendments apply to payments after December 31, 2002. SEC. 25C. INTEREST ON HIGHER EDUCATION LOANS. The tax code allows individuals to claim a credit for interest paid on qualified education loans, with a maximum credit of $1,500. The credit is reduced for taxpayers with a modified adjusted gross income exceeding $50,000 ($100,000 for joint filers).
